dt: {bc}a visible mass of particles of condensed vapor (such as water or ice) suspended in the atmosphere of a planet (such as the earth) or moon
{bc}something resembling or suggesting a cloud: such as
{bc}a light filmy, puffy, or billowy mass seeming to float in the air

dt.t: a ship under a {wi}cloud{/wi} of sail

dt: {bc}a usually visible mass of minute particles suspended in the air or a gas
{bc}an aggregation of usually obscuring matter especially in interstellar space
{bc}an aggregate of charged particles (such as electrons)
{bc}something that has a dark, lowering, or threatening aspect
{bc}a dark or opaque vein or spot (as in marble or a precious stone)
{bc}the computers and connections that support {d_link|cloud computing|cloud computing}

art.capt: cloud 1: {it}1{/it} cirrus, {it}2{/it} cirrostratus, {it}3{/it} cirrocumulus, {it}4{/it} altostratus, {it}5{/it} altocumulus, {it}6{/it} stratocumulus, {it}7{/it} nimbostratus, {it}8{/it} cumulus, {it}9{/it} cumulonimbus, {it}10{/it} stratus

et: Middle English, rock, cloud, from Old English {it}clūd{/it}; perhaps akin to Greek {it}gloutos{/it} buttock
shortdef: a visible mass of particles of condensed vapor (such as water or ice) suspended in the atmosphere of a planet (such as the earth) or moon
something resembling or suggesting a cloud: such as
a light filmy, puffy, or billowy mass seeming to float in the air
